title: Kinetic friction - accelerating box pulled across

content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="2.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> is initially at rest on a horizontal surface. The block is pulled a distance of <math alttext="10 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> in <math alttext="3.0 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> by an applied force. The coefficients of static and kinetic friction between the surface and the object are <math alttext="mu sub s, equals 0.45" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>s</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mo> </mo><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>45</mn></math> and <math alttext="mu sub k, equals 0.30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>k</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mo> </mo><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>30</mn></math>, respectively. The magnitude of the applied force is most nearly

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
